New Records: Lane Thomas hit a grand slam off Tarik Skubal in Game 5 of the AL Division Series
Key Match Events: Lane Thomas hit a three-run homer in the Guardians' 7-0 win in Game 1
Thomas hit an RBI single in the eighth to put the Guardians up by three
The Tigers threatened in the sixth, scoring a run on a single by Jake Rogers and loading the bases with two outs
Colt Keith's one-out RBI double in the seventh closed the Guardians' lead to 5-3
Eli Morgan came in and struck out both batters he faced
Thomas hit an RBI single in the eighth to put the Guardians up by three
Emmanuel Clase got the final six outs, throwing one 100-mph fastball after another
Pre-Game Insights: Before the game, Vogt was confident his team wasn’t done.
‘It feels like we’re going to New York,’ he said.
Post-Match Reflections: The Guardians could finally exhale and plan for their first ALCS since 2016.
The Tigers, who missed a chance to eliminate the Guardians at Comerica Park on Thursday, had their unimaginable late-season push end in disappointment.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians had to take down Skubal, the front-runner for the AL Cy Young Award, to keep it going.
The left-hander had not given up a run in 24 consecutive innings — 17 this postseason — before the Guardians tagged him in the fifth for five runs, tying the most he allowed in 2024.
The Guardians became one of the season’s biggest surprises, winning 92 games under Vogt, a former journeyman catcher who had no previous managerial experience.
Others: The Guardians will face the Yankees in the ALCS, setting up a series between two teams that have crossed paths six times in October.
